name: Prudential Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prudential Hotel HK
reviews.title: It was OK, not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this for our return trip to HK after 8 weeks in UK/Europe based on reviews here. We had stayed on Lantau Island going over and had 5 nights here returning to Sydney. We took the A21 bus as advised, only HK$cheap and stops right outside-walk straight ahead and take the 1st turn left [we had to ask someone] the hotel concierge desk is up about 6-7 steps. A porter took our luggage, gave us a receipt and directed us up to the Reception-a VERY small area. Check in was fairly straightforward-I’d prepaid .Luggage delivered to our Deluxe non smoking room very promptly. The room was fine-looked exactly like the hotel picture. Fairly spacious, A/C worked-it was very hot while we were there,fridge,coffee making. A fruit platter delivered on the 1st evening. It was right next to the lift-which was noisy after a while, avoid the lift.
reviews.title: Great location, spacious rooms for Hong Kong!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WIFI was included, not breakfast-there were so many eateries around that we never ate in the hotel at all, so I can’t comment on that.
reviews.title: Loved all about the Hotel
Great service
reviews.text: The pool was closed the 1st 2 days because of a typhoon warning-DH had a few dips after that-he said was fine.

What had sold me the most on this place was the location-over the Jordan MTR. That actually was not a great bonus because, there were so many escalators [6 I think ] to reach Reception-all going through the Mall, it was really slow,and tiresome. And worst of all-the escalators from Jordan were closed from 10.00pm until 10.00 am. Then, the station had to be reached by going out the concierge exit onto the street and walking to the next entrance. Tourists are likely to go out early, and return late,so location location-evaporated. We used the bus more than the MTR in the end. Octopus card in hand at all times. It was very handy to the Temple St market-we had dinner there 3 nights.
reviews.title: Nice Find at a Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: booked online and was not expecting too much, but was really pleasantly surprised. really central position on nathan road- though not in most touristy section of it, which suited us perfectly. its in same building as the MTR, so makes getting about really easy. simple to find the hotel- easy from A21 bus from airport which was cheaper than airport express and nice service. hotel staff didnt really say much- but if you arent there to make friends with them (!) then you will be fine- they are courteous but dont get too involved unless u make an effort to greet them etc- this was fine by us!! room was a twin though we thought we had asked for a double, but hotel was full, so couldnt change it. large room- comfy beds, and very clean. perfect base for exploring an awesome city! we didnt eat at hotel as there were cheaper more interesting places nearby.
reviews.title: really perfect location and great room

reviews.text: Stay there twice, once at the end of Jan, and coming back on the Feb. Both time we were upgrade to a better room. Staff are friendly, Room are clean, service was fast, room are big for HK standard, bed are comfortable, king size bed are actually california king size so they are huge. Location are the best, they are close to everything. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Very Good Stay

reviews.text: Let me first say that for those who are looking for a hotel which is near an mtr, reasonable rates, great service, fantastic location, surrounded by food stalls, 7-elevens and shopping streets, look no further.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels - worth the value

reviews.text: Initially was told by an agency to get Largos hotel, which is also near the Jorden MTR, but after checking the maps, i changed my mind. I have no idea why people over at largos gave the hotel a thumbs up for location, but trust me, after a long day of shopping in hong kong, the last thing you want would be to walk all the way back to your hotel from the jorden MTR.
reviews.title: Great basic hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, prudential hotel is simply ABOVE the MTR. Yes. Once you are back at the jorden mtr, you just need to exit and go straight up to the 5th floor and take your elevator back to the hotel. It's that fab!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Was upgraded to the Penthouse level when we arrived late at night and rooms are fully occupied.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: Super view of kowloon at night , clean and big rooms ... location is very convient except for the small front lobby .
reviews.title: Prudential is a good choice but in need of updating

reviews.text: A friend and I stayed in an executive room for 7 nights in mid August. The rooms are very nice, on the small side but still enough room. It had everything that we needed. The free wireless internet access leaves a lot to be desired. On the 15th floor we only ever had a low strength connection that constantly dropped out, this proved very annoying while trying to book airline tickets.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The rooms are of a modern finish, a bit of a contrast to the lobby area and dining room.
reviews.title: Excellent location.

reviews.text: These areas are in need of a refurbishment, the dining room is dark and (I thought) gloomy. Not the atmosphere you need while having breakfast.
reviews.title: Good hotel right on nathan road, kowloon

reviews.text: When I first checked in the executive room I was kind of pleased by the way the room looked, but to my horror when I checked the bed before I was going to sleep I found what looked like pubic hair on it, and a dead BED BUG!!! First I called the reception to ask them to change my sheets but then I decided to ask them to change room. After I did so, the new bed had hair on it, so I asked to see a manager this time and I got upgraded to the mezzanine suite, not so much of an upgrade because it was a smoking room and the mezzanine is not very convenient (I do not recommend for people with kids or old people), because you have to go up and down all the time since the bed is upstairs. Also it's very dangerous, you can hit your head very easily on those spiral stairs (which happened to one of us).
reviews.title: Very average - Not the best - Bed Bugs!

reviews.text: The included breakfast is very average, it's good that it's included though. It was kind of ok until I found a hair in the pinapple, and heard heavy sneezing coming from the kitchen.
reviews.title: Excellent service and location

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is ok, but not the best, it is near the Jordan MTR subway station, and you can walk in 15-20 to the Star Ferry, but being in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui is better.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool on the roof is not so attractive, I don't think anyone really would want to swim in it.
reviews.title: Great Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One good thing though, is the fact that internet was included in the executive room rate, which can save a lot of money knowing that a lot of hotels charge around 150HK$ for 24hrs.
reviews.title: Not too bad

description: Prudential Hotel is sat atop of Jordan Mass Transit Railway Station which is just a transient distance to China Ferry Terminal, Hung Hom and future Express Rail Link station. Adjacent to Prudential Hotel is Prudential Centre where guest can enjoy shopping and is just 3 minutes walk to Park Lane Shopper’s Boulevard and Temple Street Night Market. Prudential Hotel is a cluster of shopping, entertaining and leisure.432 stylish fully-furnished guestrooms, including 17 Duplex Suites and 2 Executive Suites, are spacious and comfort. Our guestrooms are available for broadband internet access. Stylish rooms on Executive Floors are equipped with iPod docking. To gratify guest various needs, Prudential Hotel provides smoking and non-smoking rooms for selection.
